items.title: Stanford Light-Trap Breakthrough Could Enable Million-Qubit Quantum Computers

content.abstract: Stanford researchers created miniature optical cavities that efficiently collect light from individual atoms, enabling hundreds of qubits to be read simultaneously. The approach could eventually support massive quantum networks with millions of qubits, overcoming a fundamental scalability barrier in quantum computing.

items.title: China's Artificial Sun Breaks Fundamental Fusion Density Limit

content.abstract: China's EAST tokamak exceeded the Greenwald density limit, a plasma stability threshold thought unbreakable for decades. This breakthrough brings steady-state fusion significantly closer to commercial viability, with implications for energy security and climate policy worldwide.

items.title: New START Nuclear Arms Treaty Expires: Last US-Russia Arsenal Limit Ends February 2026

content.abstract: The New START treaty, the last agreement limiting US and Russian long-range nuclear arsenals, expires in February 2026 with no replacement negotiated. This creates a new era of unconstrained nuclear competition between the two largest nuclear powers, raising global proliferation risks.

items.title: CRISPR Breakthrough: Gene Activation Without DNA Cutting via Epigenetic Editing

content.abstract: Scientists demonstrate turning genes back on without cutting DNA by removing chemical tags that act as molecular anchors. This epigenetic editing approach enables gene reactivation for therapeutic purposes without permanent genomic changes, potentially revolutionizing treatments for genetic diseases.

items.title: Brazil Launches Comprehensive Crypto Authorization Regime (Feb 2, 2026)

content.abstract: Brazil's crypto authorization regime commenced February 2, 2026, requiring AML/CFT compliance, disclosure requirements, and minimum capital between BRL 10.8M-37.2M. The US GENIUS Act creates a federal stablecoin framework with final regulations expected by July 2026. Switzerland opens crypto regulation amendments for consultation.

items.title: Europe Rebrands Energy Transition as Military and Strategic Survival Imperative

content.abstract: The European Commission's 2026 work program 'Europe's Independence Moment' explicitly frames the climate transition as military and strategic survival. This fundamental reframing from environmental policy to national security could accelerate clean energy investment while creating new geopolitical alignments.

items.title: ILO Global Employment Report: Stalled Job Quality Progress Despite Low Unemployment

content.abstract: Global unemployment remains at 4.9% in 2026, but job quality progress has stalled. Youth unemployment at 12.4% and 260 million NEET youth signal structural labor market dysfunction. Women remain 24.2% less likely to participate in the labor force. The report warns of increasing exposure to demographic and technological risks.

items.title: Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics Patent Surge: 15% Annual Growth in US Filings

source.name: International Federation of Robotics / Parola Analytics

content.abstract: Robotic patent grants in the US grew 15.21% annually over the past decade, with Physical AI extending intelligence into autonomous real-world machines. Humanoid robots for industrial applications are expanding rapidly from automotive into warehousing and manufacturing, with NVIDIA, LG, Intel, and Chinese firms leading patent filings.

items.title: AI Ethics Crisis: Society Underprepared for Psychological and Social Effects of AI

content.abstract: Ethicist Shannon Vallor warns society is underprepared for AI's psychological and social effects. While AI-powered mental health tools show remarkable accuracy, governance gaps persist in privacy, algorithmic accountability, and access equity. AI is reshaping human behavior, democracy, and reality perception with uncertain long-term consequences.

items.title: US-China Critical Minerals Confrontation Reshapes Global Supply Chains

content.abstract: China's near-total control over critical minerals and rare earth elements creates key geopolitical leverage. Beijing and Washington are shaping a new bipolar framework, with critical minerals becoming the centerpiece of strategic competition. This forces allies to choose between supply chain security and economic efficiency.

items.title: China Deployed 300+ GW Solar/Wind in 2025 — More Than Total US Renewable History

content.abstract: China installed over 300 GW of new solar and wind capacity in 2025 alone — equivalent to 300 nuclear power plants — exceeding the total US renewable capacity built historically. China also exported $200B+ in clean energy technology, fundamentally reshaping global energy markets and manufacturing geography.

items.title: WEST Reactor Achieves 20-Minute Steady-State Fusion Plasma — Pulsed-to-Steady Transition

content.abstract: France's WEST reactor maintained stable high-confinement plasma for over 20 minutes, a monumental jump from seconds of stability achieved previously. Combined with $9.7 billion in private fusion investment and 50+ startups, this signals the beginning of the pulsed-to-steady-state transition critical for commercial fusion power.

items.title: NY FAIR Act (Feb 17, 2026): Unfair Business Practices Now Explicitly Prohibited

content.abstract: New York's FAIR Act takes effect February 17, 2026, explicitly prohibiting unfair, deceptive or abusive acts across all business activities. This heightens regulatory risk for payments firms, fintechs, and banks around product design, pricing transparency, and consumer protection, signaling broader regulatory tightening.

items.title: Corporate Greenhushing: Companies Deliberately Hide Climate Progress to Avoid Backlash

content.abstract: A growing number of companies are deliberately downplaying or concealing their climate progress through 'greenhushing' — the opposite of greenwashing. Companies fear backlash from both climate activists (for not doing enough) and anti-ESG forces (for doing too much), creating a chilling effect on climate communication transparency.

items.title: Demographic Cliff: Skills Mismatch as College Grads Surge While AI Cools White-Collar Hiring

content.abstract: By 2030, 1 in 5 Americans will be 65+, creating more grandparents than grandchildren. Bachelor's degree holders surge while AI cools white-collar hiring, creating a simultaneous surplus of graduates and shortage of nurses, machinists, and carpenters. Workers with AI expertise command 56% salary premiums. 78% of businesses now use AI, up from 55% a year ago.
